etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in John Milton (1608–1674), poet and polemicist. From ancient Greek προαίρεσις choice of one thing before another, considered by Aristotle as characteristic of moral action from προ- + αἵρεσις choice, after προαιρεῖσθαι to choose deliberately, to prefer

definitions: Practical deliberation or reasoning leading to choice; the power to choose or make a decision.
